title: Google SheetsMODE Function

metadata.description: Learn about Google SheetsMODE Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title:
Google Sheets
MODE Function

MODE Function
The
MODE
function is a premade function in Google Sheets
content_sections.content:
, which is used to find the most common value(s).
There are two versions, which are typed
MODE.SNGL
or
MODE.MULT
that gets a list of cells:
=MODE.SNGL(
value1
,
[value2, ...]
)
=MODE.MULT(
value1
,
[value2, ...]
)
You can
select cells one by one, but also ranges, or even multiple ranges.
MODE.SNGL
does the same as
MODE
and returns
only one value
(picking the first it finds).
MODE.MULT
returns multiple values if there are more than one that is the most common.
Note:
The mode is a type of average value, which describes where most of the data is located. You can read more about mode in the
Statistics Mode Chapter
.
Note:
The mode functions work with both text values and numbers.
Let's have a look at some examples!
Mode Function Example (SNGL)
Find the most common number of all the different Pokeballs in the trainers' inventories.
Trainer	Pokeball	Great Ball	Ultraball	Master Ball
      Iva	10	4	1	1
      Liam	12	3	0	1
      Jenny	15	1	3	1
      Iben	12	2	6	0
      Adora	10	4	1	1
      Kasper	9	2	1	0
              
      MODE
Copy Values
The
MODE.SNGL
function, step by step:
Select the cell
B9

content_sections.title: Type
content_sections.content:
=MODE
Click the
MODE.SNGL
command
Specify the range
B2:E7
for all the different types of Pokeballs
Hit enter
Now, the function returns the most common value in the range:
It returns the number
1
which is seen 7 times. The closest number to it is
3
and
4
which are seen 3 times each.
Mode Function Example (MULT)
Find the most common number of Pokeballs in the trainers' inventories.
Trainer	Pokeball
      Iva	10
      Liam	12
      Jenny	15
      Iben	12
      Adora	10
      Kasper	9
        
      MODE
Copy Values
The
MODE.MULT
function, step by step:
Select the cell
B9

content_sections.title: Type
content_sections.content:
=MODE
Click the
MODE.MULT
command
Specify the range
B2:B7
for the Pokeballs
Hit enter
Now, the function returns the most common
values
in the range:
It returns the number
10
in the first cell (
B9
) and the number
12
in the second cell (
B10
). Both 10 and 12 are seen twice, which is more than any of the other values.

★
+1

content_sections.title: Example
content_sections.code:
Trainer	Pokeball	Great Ball	Ultraball	Master Ball
      Iva	10	4	1	1
      Liam	12	3	0	1
      Jenny	15	1	3	1
      Iben	12	2	6	0
      Adora	10	4	1	1
      Kasper	9	2	1	0
              
      MODE

content_sections.title: Example
content_sections.code:
Trainer	Pokeball
      Iva	10
      Liam	12
      Jenny	15
      Iben	12
      Adora	10
      Kasper	9
        
      MODE

summary: This tutorial covers Google SheetsMODE Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use Google SheetsMODE Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of Google SheetsMODE Function and how to apply it in your projects.
